properties.headline: Hard Freeze Watch issued February 2 at 1:13PM PST until February 5 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, areas of northwest to north
winds 25 to 35 mph with damaging gusts up to 60 mph. For the
Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures in the mid 20s to lower
30s will be likely in wind sheltered areas. For the Hard Freeze
Watches, sub-freezing temperatures in the 20s will be possible.

* WHERE...Ventura County Interior Valleys.

* WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 8 PM this evening to noon
PST Monday. For the Freeze Warning, from 3 AM to 9 AM PST
Monday. For the Hard Freeze Watches, from late Monday evening
through early Tuesday morning and late Tuesday evening through
early Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down large objects such as
trees and power lines. Power outages are expected. Travel will
be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Freezing
conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and
possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds expected tonight near the
Highway 33 corridor, including Lake Casitas and Ojai. The
coldest temperatures are expected in the wind sheltered
portions of the Ojai Valley.
properties.instruction:
People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around
trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of
your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if
you must drive.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should
be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have
in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-
ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 9 AM PST MONDAY... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
